head.title: IN BRIEF: Transportation; COUNTY AIDS COMMUTERS

hedline.hl1: IN BRIEF: Transportation; COUNTY AIDS COMMUTERS

abstract.p: Westchester County, NY, to lease eight vans to Tarrytown, Dobbs Ferry and New Castle and to Westchester Community Opportunity Program, WestHab and Westchester Community College for commuter and other services (S)

block.p: Westchester will help three local governments, two nonprofit agencies and a college provide better public transit.The county will lease eight 20-passenger vans for $1 a year up to five years to Tarrytown, for commuter service to the train station and historic sites; Dobbs Ferry, for a service to the train; New Castle, for shuttles between park-and-ride lots and the Chappaqua train station; Westchester Community Opportunity Program, to help people get to work; Westchester Community College, between the college and various downtown areas; and WestHab, to provide transportation to jobs and training sites.

Westchester will help three local governments, two nonprofit agencies and a college provide better public transit.The county will lease eight 20-passenger vans for $1 a year up to five years to Tarrytown, for commuter service to the train station and historic sites; Dobbs Ferry, for a service to the train; New Castle, for shuttles between park-and-ride lots and the Chappaqua train station; Westchester Community Opportunity Program, to help people get to work; Westchester Community College, between the college and various downtown areas; and WestHab, to provide transportation to jobs and training sites.
